entry.title: LazyJ 1.0.5
entry.content:
LazyJ 1.0.5 was released on 24.11.2008. You can always download the latest version from here.

Full changelog is here.

Short summary of changes:
  • Sendmail now correctly sets and uses the charset encoding
  • ExpirationCache uses only one thread to watch all the object queues
  • Caching classes remember null values
  • Faster processing of tags by resolving them to StringFormat instances at parse time; commented sections are completely removed from the HTML output
  • New functions to download a URL to the local disk, convert HTML to simple text (very basic formatting)
  • Other small improvements and fixes

entry.title: LazyJ 1.0.4
entry.content:
LazyJ 1.0.4 was released on 11.12.2007. You can always download the latest version from here.

Full changelog is here.

Short summary of changes:
  • A new package, lazyj.widgets, was added. It should make building of SELECT elements easier, whether you want to load the options as a list or as a tree from the database or you want to build them by hand.
  • Bugfix: lazyj.mail.MailDate: incorrect timezone sign.

entry.title: LazyJ 1.0.3
entry.content:
LazyJ 1.0.3 was released on 23.11.2007. You can always download the latest version from here.

Full changelog is here.

Short summary of changes:
  • New notifications framework with email and Y!M already implemented.
  • New type of cache that expires the entries after a preset interval.
  • Made all the classes in lazyj.cache generics.
  • Implement PostgreSQL arrays encoding and decoding in DBFunctions.
  • Some minor bugs fixed, a bit of refactoring and more documentation to the classes.
